trans-unit.source: Deploy DocumentDB and Azure App Service Web Apps using an Azure Resource Manager Template | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy DocumentDB and Azure App Service Web Apps using an Azure Resource Manager Template | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to deploy a DocumentDB account, Azure App Service Web Apps, and a sample web application using an Azure Resource Manager template.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to deploy a DocumentDB account, Azure App Service Web Apps, and a sample web application using an Azure Resource Manager template.

trans-unit.source: Deploy DocumentDB and Azure App Service Web Apps using an Azure Resource Manager Template
trans-unit.target: Deploy DocumentDB and Azure App Service Web Apps using an Azure Resource Manager Template

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy and integrate [Microsoft Azure DocumentDB](http://azure.microsoft.com/services/documentdb/), an [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) web app, and a sample web application.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy and integrate [Microsoft Azure DocumentDB](http://azure.microsoft.com/services/documentdb/), an [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) web app, and a sample web application.

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: How can I use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy and integrate a DocumentDB account and a web app in Azure App Service?
trans-unit.target: How can I use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy and integrate a DocumentDB account and a web app in Azure App Service?

trans-unit.source: How can I use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy and integrate a DocumentDB account, a web app in App Service Web Apps, and a Webdeploy application?
trans-unit.target: How can I use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy and integrate a DocumentDB account, a web app in App Service Web Apps, and a Webdeploy application?

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] While this tutorial does not assume prior experience with Azure Resource Manager templates, JSON, or Azure PowerShell, should you wish to modify the referenced templates or deployment options, then knowledge of each of these areas will be required.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] While this tutorial does not assume prior experience with Azure Resource Manager templates, JSON, or Azure PowerShell, should you wish to modify the referenced templates or deployment options, then knowledge of each of these areas will be required.

trans-unit.source: Before following the instructions in this tutorial, ensure that you have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before following the instructions in this tutorial, ensure that you have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Azure is a subscription-based platform.
trans-unit.target: Azure is a subscription-based platform.

trans-unit.source: For more information about obtaining a subscription, see [Purchase Options](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/), [Member Offers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/), or [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: For more information about obtaining a subscription, see [Purchase Options](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/), [Member Offers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/), or [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [About Azure Storage Accounts](../storage-whatis-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [About Azure Storage Accounts](../storage-whatis-account.md).

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Download and extract the sample files
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Download and extract the sample files

trans-unit.source: Let's start by downloading the sample files we will use in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Let's start by downloading the sample files we will use in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Download the [Create a DocumentDB account, Web Apps, and deploy a demo application sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo.zip) to a local folder (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates) and extract the files.
trans-unit.target: Download the [Create a DocumentDB account, Web Apps, and deploy a demo application sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo.zip) to a local folder (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates) and extract the files.

trans-unit.source: This sample will deploy a DocumentDB account, an App Service web app, and a web application.
trans-unit.target: This sample will deploy a DocumentDB account, an App Service web app, and a web application.

trans-unit.source: It will also automatically configure the web application to connect to the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: It will also automatically configure the web application to connect to the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Download the [Create a DocumentDB account and Web Apps sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebSite.zip) to a local folder (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates) and extract the files.
trans-unit.target: Download the [Create a DocumentDB account and Web Apps sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebSite.zip) to a local folder (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates) and extract the files.

trans-unit.source: This sample will deploy a DocumentDB account, an App Service web app, and will modify the web app's configuration to easily surface DocumentDB connection information, but does not include a web application.
trans-unit.target: This sample will deploy a DocumentDB account, an App Service web app, and will modify the web app's configuration to easily surface DocumentDB connection information, but does not include a web application.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Note that depending on the security settings of your computer, you may need to unblock the extracted files by right-clicking, clicking **Properties**, and clicking **Unblock**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Note that depending on the security settings of your computer, you may need to unblock the extracted files by right-clicking, clicking **Properties**, and clicking **Unblock**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Properties window with the Unblock button highlighted
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Properties window with the Unblock button highlighted

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Deploy the Document account, App Service web app and demo application sample
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Deploy the Document account, App Service web app and demo application sample

trans-unit.source: Now let's deploy our first template.
trans-unit.target: Now let's deploy our first template.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] The template does not validate that the web app name and DocumentDB account name entered below are a) valid and b) available.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] The template does not validate that the web app name and DocumentDB account name entered below are a) valid and b) available.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended that you verify the availability of the names you plan to supply prior to running the PowerShell deployment script.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended that you verify the availability of the names you plan to supply prior to running the PowerShell deployment script.

trans-unit.source: Open Microsoft Azure PowerShell and navigate to the folder in which you downloaded and extracted the [Create a DocumentDB account, App Service web app, and deploy a demo application sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo.zip) (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates\CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo).
trans-unit.target: Open Microsoft Azure PowerShell and navigate to the folder in which you downloaded and extracted the [Create a DocumentDB account, App Service web app, and deploy a demo application sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo.zip) (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates\CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo).

trans-unit.source: We're going to run the CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo.ps1 PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: We're going to run the CreateDocDBWebsiteTodo.ps1 PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: The script takes the following mandatory parameters:
trans-unit.target: The script takes the following mandatory parameters:

trans-unit.source: WebsiteName: Specifies the App Service web app name and is used to construct the URL that you will use to access the web app (e.g. if you specify "mydemodocdbwebapp", then the URL by which you will access the web app will be mydemodocdbwebapp.azurewebsites.net).
trans-unit.target: WebsiteName: Specifies the App Service web app name and is used to construct the URL that you will use to access the web app (e.g. if you specify "mydemodocdbwebapp", then the URL by which you will access the web app will be mydemodocdbwebapp.azurewebsites.net).

trans-unit.source: ResourceGroupName: Specifies the name of the Azure Resource Group to deploy.
trans-unit.target: ResourceGroupName: Specifies the name of the Azure Resource Group to deploy.

trans-unit.source: If the specified Resource Group doesn't exist, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: If the specified Resource Group doesn't exist, it will be created.

trans-unit.source: docDBAccountName: Specifies the name of the DocumentDB account to create.
trans-unit.target: docDBAccountName: Specifies the name of the DocumentDB account to create.

trans-unit.source: location: Specifies the Azure location in which to create the DocumentDB and web app resources.
trans-unit.target: location: Specifies the Azure location in which to create the DocumentDB and web app resources.

trans-unit.source: Valid values are East Asia, Southeast Asia, East US, West US, North Europe, West Europe (note that the location value provided is case sensitive).
trans-unit.target: Valid values are East Asia, Southeast Asia, East US, West US, North Europe, West Europe (note that the location value provided is case sensitive).

trans-unit.source: Here is an example command to run the script:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example command to run the script:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Note that you will be prompted to enter your Azure account username and password as part of running the script.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Note that you will be prompted to enter your Azure account username and password as part of running the script.

trans-unit.source: The full deployment will take between 10 and 15 minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: The full deployment will take between 10 and 15 minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: And here is an example of the resulting output:
trans-unit.target: And here is an example of the resulting output:

trans-unit.source: Before we look at our sample application, let's understand what the template deployment accomplished:
trans-unit.target: Before we look at our sample application, let's understand what the template deployment accomplished:

trans-unit.source: An App Service web app was created.
trans-unit.target: An App Service web app was created.

trans-unit.source: A DocumentDB account was created.
trans-unit.target: A DocumentDB account was created.

trans-unit.source: A Web Deploy package was deployed to the App Service web app
trans-unit.target: A Web Deploy package was deployed to the App Service web app

trans-unit.source: The web app configuration was modified such that the DocumentDB endpoint and primary master key were surfaced as application settings.
trans-unit.target: The web app configuration was modified such that the DocumentDB endpoint and primary master key were surfaced as application settings.

trans-unit.source: A series of default monitoring rules were created.
trans-unit.target: A series of default monitoring rules were created.

trans-unit.source: In order to use the application, simply navigate to the web app URL (in the example above, the URL would be http://mydemodocdbwebapp.azurewebsites.net).
trans-unit.target: In order to use the application, simply navigate to the web app URL (in the example above, the URL would be http://mydemodocdbwebapp.azurewebsites.net).

trans-unit.source: You'll see the following web application:
trans-unit.target: You'll see the following web application:

trans-unit.source: Sample Todo application
trans-unit.target: Sample Todo application

trans-unit.source: Go ahead and create a couple of tasks and then let's open the [Microsoft Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Go ahead and create a couple of tasks and then let's open the [Microsoft Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: Choose to browse Resource Groups and select the Resource Group we created during the deployment (in the sample above, myDemoResourceGroup).
trans-unit.target: Choose to browse Resource Groups and select the Resource Group we created during the deployment (in the sample above, myDemoResourceGroup).

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Azure portal with the myDemoResourceGroup highlighted
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Azure portal with the myDemoResourceGroup highlighted

trans-unit.source: Notice how the resource map in the Summary lens shows all of our related resources (DocumentDB account, App Service web app, Monitoring).
trans-unit.target: Notice how the resource map in the Summary lens shows all of our related resources (DocumentDB account, App Service web app, Monitoring).

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Summary lens
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Summary lens

trans-unit.source: Click your DocumentDB account, and launch Query Explorer (near the bottom of the account blade).
trans-unit.target: Click your DocumentDB account, and launch Query Explorer (near the bottom of the account blade).

trans-unit.source: Run the default query, "SELECT * FROM c" and inspect the results.
trans-unit.target: Run the default query, "SELECT * FROM c" and inspect the results.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the query has retrieved the JSON representation of the todo items you created in step 7 above.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the query has retrieved the JSON representation of the todo items you created in step 7 above.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to experiment with queries; for example, try running SELECT * FROM c WHERE c.isComplete = true to return all todo items which have been marked as complete.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to experiment with queries; for example, try running SELECT * FROM c WHERE c.isComplete = true to return all todo items which have been marked as complete.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to explore the DocumentDB portal experience or modify the sample Todo application.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to explore the DocumentDB portal experience or modify the sample Todo application.

trans-unit.source: When you're ready, let's deploy another template.
trans-unit.target: When you're ready, let's deploy another template.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Deploy the Document account and web app sample
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Deploy the Document account and web app sample

trans-unit.source: Now let's deploy our second template.
trans-unit.target: Now let's deploy our second template.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] The template does not validate that the web app name and DocumentDB account name entered below are a) valid and b) available.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] The template does not validate that the web app name and DocumentDB account name entered below are a) valid and b) available.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended that you verify the availability of the names you plan to supply prior to running the PowerShell deployment script.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended that you verify the availability of the names you plan to supply prior to running the PowerShell deployment script.

trans-unit.source: Open Microsoft Azure PowerShell and navigate to the folder in which you downloaded and extracted the [Create a DocumentDB account and web app sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebSite.zip) (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates\CreateDocDBWebsite).
trans-unit.target: Open Microsoft Azure PowerShell and navigate to the folder in which you downloaded and extracted the [Create a DocumentDB account and web app sample](https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/samples/CreateDocDBWebSite.zip) (e.g. C:\DocumentDBTemplates\CreateDocDBWebsite).

trans-unit.source: We're going to run the CreateDocDBWebsite.ps1 PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: We're going to run the CreateDocDBWebsite.ps1 PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: The script takes the same parameters as the first template we deployed, namely:
trans-unit.target: The script takes the same parameters as the first template we deployed, namely:

trans-unit.source: WebsiteName: Specifies the App Service web app name and is used to construct the URL that you will use to access the web app (e.g. if you specify "myotherdocumentdbwebapp", then the URL by which you will access the web app will be myotherdocumentdbwebapp.azurewebsites.net).
trans-unit.target: WebsiteName: Specifies the App Service web app name and is used to construct the URL that you will use to access the web app (e.g. if you specify "myotherdocumentdbwebapp", then the URL by which you will access the web app will be myotherdocumentdbwebapp.azurewebsites.net).

trans-unit.source: ResourceGroupName: Specifies the name of the Azure Resource Group to deploy.
trans-unit.target: ResourceGroupName: Specifies the name of the Azure Resource Group to deploy.

trans-unit.source: If the specified Resource Group doesn't exist, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: If the specified Resource Group doesn't exist, it will be created.

trans-unit.source: docDBAccountName: Specifies the name of the DocumentDB account to create.
trans-unit.target: docDBAccountName: Specifies the name of the DocumentDB account to create.

trans-unit.source: location: Specifies the Azure location in which to create the DocumentDB and web app resources.
trans-unit.target: location: Specifies the Azure location in which to create the DocumentDB and web app resources.

trans-unit.source: Valid values are East Asia, Southeast Asia, East US, West US, North Europe, West Europe (note that the location value provided is case sensitive).
trans-unit.target: Valid values are East Asia, Southeast Asia, East US, West US, North Europe, West Europe (note that the location value provided is case sensitive).

trans-unit.source: Here is an example command to run the script:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example command to run the script:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Note that you will be prompted to enter your Azure account username and password as part of running the script.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Note that you will be prompted to enter your Azure account username and password as part of running the script.

trans-unit.source: The full deployment will take between 10 and 15 minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: The full deployment will take between 10 and 15 minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: The deployment output will be very similar to the first template example.
trans-unit.target: The deployment output will be very similar to the first template example.

trans-unit.source: Before we open the Azure Preview portal, let's understand what this template deployment accomplished:
trans-unit.target: Before we open the Azure Preview portal, let's understand what this template deployment accomplished:

trans-unit.source: An App Service web app was created.
trans-unit.target: An App Service web app was created.

trans-unit.source: A DocumentDB account was created.
trans-unit.target: A DocumentDB account was created.

trans-unit.source: The web app configuration was modified such that the Azure DocumentDB endpoint, primary master key, and secondary master key were surfaced as application settings.
trans-unit.target: The web app configuration was modified such that the Azure DocumentDB endpoint, primary master key, and secondary master key were surfaced as application settings.

trans-unit.source: A series of default monitoring rules were created.
trans-unit.target: A series of default monitoring rules were created.

trans-unit.source: Let's open the [Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com), choose to browse Resource Groups and select the Resource Group we created during the deployment (in the sample above, myOtherDemoResourceGroup).
trans-unit.target: Let's open the [Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com), choose to browse Resource Groups and select the Resource Group we created during the deployment (in the sample above, myOtherDemoResourceGroup).

trans-unit.source: In the Summary lens, click the web app which was just deployed.
trans-unit.target: In the Summary lens, click the web app which was just deployed.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Summary lens with the myotherdocumentdbwebapp web app highlighted
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Summary lens with the myotherdocumentdbwebapp web app highlighted

trans-unit.source: On the web app's blade, click **All settings**, then **Application Settings** and note how there are application settings present for the DocumentDB endpoint and each of the DocumentDB master keys.
trans-unit.target: On the web app's blade, click **All settings**, then **Application Settings** and note how there are application settings present for the DocumentDB endpoint and each of the DocumentDB master keys.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the web app, Settings, and application settings blades
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the web app, Settings, and application settings blades

trans-unit.source: Feel free to continue exploring the Azure Preview portal, or follow one of our DocumentDB [samples](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=402386) to create your own DocumentDB application.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to continue exploring the Azure Preview portal, or follow one of our DocumentDB [samples](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=402386) to create your own DocumentDB application.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Congratulations!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations!

trans-unit.source: You've deployed DocumentDB, App Service web app and a sample web application using Azure Resource Manager templates.
trans-unit.target: You've deployed DocumentDB, App Service web app and a sample web application using Azure Resource Manager templates.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about DocumentDB, click [here](http://azure.com/docdb).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about DocumentDB, click [here](http://azure.com/docdb).

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure App Service Web apps, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=325362).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure App Service Web apps, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=325362).

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager templates, click [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790549.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager templates, click [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790549.aspx).

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
